newsitem.title: USA: Arizona Public shuts 745 MW N.M. coal unit.
newsitem.headline: Arizona Public shuts 745 MW N.M. coal unit.

text.p: Arizona Public Service Co shut a 745 megawatt (MW) coal-fired power unit at the Four Corners generating station near Farmington, N.M., to repair a boiler tube leak, the company said on Thursday.
"It was taken off line early this morning," said company spokesman Bruce Richardson, adding the unit would likely be back in service "in a few days, perhaps as many as six."
He said the outage would not affect delivery to customers since weather in its service region has begun to moderate somewhat from an earlier heat wave.
The unit, Four Corners 4, was shut Aug 10 for about six days for the same problem.
Arizona Public operates and has a 15 percent interest in Four Corners' units 4 and 5.
Edison International's Southern California Edison Co has a 48 percent interest in units 4 and 5, each of which have a generation capacity of 745 MW.
Arizona Public Service, a subsidiary of Pinnacle West Capital Corp, has 100 percent ownership of Four Corners units 1, 2, and 3.
Units 1 and 2 each have a generation capacity 170 MW, while unit 3 has a capacity of 220 MW.
